definition: namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: He was anointed princeps ; the Roman empire is said to begin with his accession.
sentences.chinese: 他被奉爲元首，羅馬帝國據說就是從他即位開始。

sentences.english: The king throned the new castle he had taken from his enemies.
sentences.chinese: 這國王在他從敵人那奪來的新城堡即位爲王。

sentences.english: Queen Victoria acceded to the throne in 1837.
sentences.chinese: 維多利亞女王於1837年即位。

sentences.english: Shen Zong Emperor began to assume a strategic offensive to the West Xia after his enthronement.
sentences.chinese: 宋神宗即位後，開始在戰略上對西夏採取攻勢。

sentences.english: After the death of Zhao Kuangyin, his brother ascends the throne.
sentences.chinese: 趙匡胤死後，趙光義即位。

sentences.english: In 361 BC, Duke Xiao came to the throne of the State of Qin.
sentences.chinese: 公元前361年，秦國的新國君秦孝公即位。

definition: to succeed to a title/to inherit
to confer a title on (an empress or a prince)
to change an emperor's or ruler's reign title (old)
to hold a court audience/to govern from the imperial throne (applies esp. to Empress Dowager or Regent)
